item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi - I’m Rohit!

I currently work on AI/ML at Toyota Connected and am in graduate school at Northwestern University. My focus is on building reliable, efficient, and scalable AI solutions.

Over the past year, I’ve contributed to projects improving customer experience, safety, and mobility through AI. I’m excited to apply AI to broader consumer challenges.

I also love music production. I switch off between playing the guitar, experimenting with mixing audio, and working with artists.

item.title: Projects & Docs
item.description:
My Projects

Here are some of my GitHub repositories:

Vrep

Quick viz for grokking your repo.

Circ

Circ aims to provide real-time object detection and event logging. Built with Flask, OpenCV, and OpenAI’s GPT-3.5 Turbo model. Circ allows users to monitor their surroundings through live video feed.

Pic2Prose

Bridging OCR and NLP.

ShowAndTell

Classifying human emotion and using Generative Models to aid in film production.

ML-Theory-Capstone

Senior Data Science Capstone Project advised by Mikhail Belkin and Parthe Pandit.

item.title: 1. My thoughts on AI and the future!
item.description:
AI: Allen Iverson

Yes, we‚Äôre talking about Allen Iverson, not your fancy chatbots or ‚Äúmachine learning‚Äù fluff. Let‚Äôs be real: this AI practically changed basketball (and culture) forever. And guess what? He‚Äôs only getting started.

  1. Iverson‚Äôs Prime? It‚Äôs Now Forget the retirement talk‚Äîtime off just means he‚Äôs coming back with bionic knees (figuratively, at least). While others ‚Äúmanage loads‚Äù and skip games left and right, Iverson‚Äôs been quietly perfecting the art of the crossover. If mid-40s comebacks were easy, everyone would do it. But that‚Äôs exactly why AI will.

His expertise spans across Python, PyTorch, MongoDB, and various AI platforms, making him a valuable asset for any organization looking to leverage cutting-edge technology for business growth. üöÄ
